website_content.content:
[Content truncated]...4 agents, as far as I could tell. The agents would wear golf shirts and shorts, have an ear piece, and a gun.  
When they were there, we had to be very strict about no cars stopping in front of the club entrance. The Secret Service vehicles would always park in the fire lane so they could leave at a moments notice. The agents would stay out of the way but within view. However, when the girls were swimming they would step up to the pool’s edge and watch them the way a lifeguard would. I served the girls a few times from the snackbar. There was no poison testing of food or anything like that, but secret service did carefully watch me prepare it.  
Basically, as far as I could tell, the security plan involved watching the girls from a distance of no more than 20 meters at all times, and having a quick escape route
Upvote ·

Free speech campaigner and science fiction author · Author has 199 answers and 349.5K answer views
 · 
As  says, the Secret Service are unlikely to give away the precise details because that would be a security risk.
But popular culture can give us some clues. In The West Wing, President Bartlett's daughter Zoe is at college and protected by the secret service. There are agents dressed in plain clothes hanging about in the dorm room opposite and at entrances to the building.
Tom Clancy's Executive Orders describes the security for President Jack Ryan's kids. It's a while since I read it, but if I recall correctly the agents commandeer school rooms to act as an operating base, and also have

As  says, the Secret Service are unlikely to give away the precise details because that would be a security risk.
But popular culture can give us some clues. In The West Wing, President Bartlett's daughter Zoe is at college and protected by the secret service. There are agents dressed in plain clothes hanging about in the dorm room opposite and at entrances to the building.
Tom Clancy's Executive Orders describes the security for President Jack Ryan's kids. It's a while since I read it, but if I recall correctly the agents commandeer school rooms to act as an operating base, and also have security check points at the entrance to the school to check the vehicles going in. There will also be agents patrolling the permits of the school.

website_content.content:
by Carl Anthony
on March 20, 2016

Malia Obama (left foreground), followed by her sister Sasha and mother, First Lady Michelle Obama, and behind them Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau as formal guests at the state dinner for the Canadian Prime Minister. (amazingstoriesaroundtheworld.blogspot.com)
Over the last seven years, the White House press corps has become accustomed to being able to closely observe the First Daughters Malia Obama, 17, and Sasha Obama, 14, only during their rare appearances.
The President and his daughters during the 2015 ceremony accepting a Thanksgiving turkey.
The two presidential daughters have been front and center at larger public events like their father’s two presidential inaugurations, the annual children’s festival that is the Easter Egg Roll on the White House South Lawn and ceremonies like the annual acceptance (and pardon) of a Thanksgiving turkey on the North Portico.
Malia Obama at the Canadian state dinner.
The media and, through them, the American public were thus startled to see the two young women dressed in formal gowns and attending a White House state dinner as official guests, on Thursday, March 10, 2016.
The reason for this comparatively rare form of presidential entertaining, under the direction of the First Lady, was to honor another world leader’s child, Justin Trudeau, who followed his father’s path and went on to win his nation’s election as Prime Minister of Canada.
Sasha Obama speaks with Canadian native, actor Ryan Reynolds...[Content truncated]

Its historical accuracy lends it some credibility, but it may lack depth in current news analysis.

Lauren Tuck
Sasha and Malia Obama Wore $20K Dresses to the Canada State Dinner
==================================================================
Lauren Tuck
·News Editor
March 11, 2016 at 9:03 AM
Link Copied
!
_Malia Obama wearing a strapless gown at the state dinner. (Photo: Getty Images)_
For the first time since being elected,  visited the United States. The “quite good-looking Canadian delegation” was welcomed to Washington, D.C., by President Obama and his family with a . But the event wasn’t just a first for Trudeau — Sasha and Malia Obama made their state-dinner debut as well.
“When I was first elected to this office, Malia was just 10 and Sasha was 7. And they grow up too fast,” the president said during his opening remarks at the event on Thursday night. “Now . … And I’m starting to choke up.”
!
_The Naeem Khan gown Malia Obama wore._
What might have also made Obama choke up was looking at the price of his daughters’ dresses. While their mother opted for a custom strapless number from one of her favorite designers, Jason Wu, her daughters went with . Malia, 17, who was seated next to  Lorne Michaels and , wore a strapless faille gown with crystal beading from the pre-fall 2015 collection. The 100 percent silk piece is no longer available for purchase, but it . The embellished piece didn’t need any more bl...[Content truncated]

website_quality_evaluation.justification: Yahoo News aggregates content from various sources, including reputable outlets. However, it also includes stories from less reliable sources, making it a mixed platform. While it provides a range of information, the reliance on aggregation means the quality of the news can vary greatly. Given the potential for presenting unverified information, a score of 6 reflects moderate reliability.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: This source mentions that the dresses worn by Sasha and Malia Obama at the Canada State Dinner were $20,000 each. This raises the question about the claim of $40,000 total and confirms that the dresses were indeed expensive, though it does not confirm that the total cost was over $40,000 directly.

metatags.twitter:title: How Sasha and Malia Obama Shut Down Their Critics With the 2016 Christmas Card
metatags.author: Condé Nast
metatags.og:title: How Sasha and Malia Obama Shut Down Their Critics With the 2016 Christmas Card
metatags.article:author: Alyssa Hardy

website_content.content:
[Content truncated]...Sasha and Malia Wear Naeem Khan Gowns in the 2016 Obama Family Christmas Card
=============================================================================
The ultimate clapback.
!
By 
December 9, 2016
Every holiday season, it's tradition that the presidential family sends out a Christmas card to hundreds of thousands of lucky recipients. This year marks the Obamas' last Christmas card as the first family (_tear_) so they really wanted to bring it home in style. They chose an image from the Canada State Dinner this past Spring, when the whole family was dressed to the nines. First Lady Michelle stunned in a strapless dress by Jason Wu while President Obama chose a classic tuxedo.  looked resplendent on the arms of their parents, both in gowns by Naeem Khan.
#### Instagram content
This content can also be viewed on the site it  from.
Around the time the photo was taken, Malia and Sasha's $17,990 and $19,990 (respectively) gowns caused a bit of a controversy. A news anchor in San Fransisco criticized the price tag — and some conservative media outlets even claimed the gowns were purchased using tax payer dollars. It was a facetious claim, considering that most industry insiders are well aware that political figures — including Michelle Obama, Hillary Clinton and Melania Trump — either purchase their clothing with their own money, or wear it on loan from a designer. As the White House press department later explained, in Sasha and Malia's case, the dresses were indeed on loan from the designer. The media outrage was completely unwarranted — and by immortalizing their looks in this year's Christmas card, the Obama girls certainly had the last laugh. In fact, it may be the classiest comeback ever.
With this card, they inspire us to remember the State Dinner as a special moment for their family, and a perfectly appropriate occasion for gowns of that caliber. At the end of the day, we can only sum this card up with one word: iconic.
**Related:** 
**Check this out:**
]
 is a journalist and the author of “Worn Out: How Our Clothes Cover Up Fashion’s Sins.” She was formerly the Fashion News Editor at Teen Vogue and the Senior News Editor at InStyle. Her work has appeared in Vogue, Business of Fashion, Marie Claire, NYLON, Refinery29 and more.... 
Contributing Editor
*   
*

Celebrity Style
And it's still available.
7 slides
By Alyssa Hardy
Celebrity Style
From printed dresses to...[Content truncated]

metatags.twitter:description: Their appearance at the "Christmas in Washington" concert has sparked a heightened, but misplaced, interest in the way the young sisters dress.

website_content.content:
[Content truncated]... go there. It’s no wonder Barack has such a tight grip on his daughter in that photo.
We are in a strange time when a slew of actresses 15 years of age or younger who have become style stars seem to constantly redefine age-appropriate dressing for young teens and preteens. Hailee Steinfeld, who is now 15, became the face of Miu Miu at just 14 years old, having cemented her fashion credibility by earning copious praise for wearing  that would have been difficult for most adults to pull off to the SAG awards this year. In her company is Chloe Moretz, 14, who regularly wears runway looks by the likes of , , and . There’s also Elle Fanning, who at 13 has , and counts among her favorite labels , , and Rodarte (at 12 years old, Fanning was ).
But unlike Sasha and Malia, these young women are building careers around their fashion-forward image, probably angling for a spot in the same sphere of influence as someone like two-time _Vogue_ cover girl and Chanel face Blake Lively. And even as they do that, their efforts to solidify a commitment to fashion feels strange at times, in the same way it feels strange when 15-year-old models snatch up so many slots in runway shows and ad campaigns for some of the world’s most expensive labels, neither a new phenomenon nor debate. Do designers really think of clothes with three-, four-, or five-figure price tags as child’s play? And what does their affinity for this age group say about the customers who want to buy their things?
Unlike these young actresses (and their mother Michelle, even), Sasha and Malia are not posing for fashion magazines or endorsing certain labels. They are not going around town in Chanel. And they would probably benefit from the press not placing too much emphasis on their image since being an involuntarily famous young woman these days, when no one can be the right weight or consistently wear enough of the right things, is hard enough as it is. After all, those who are praised will inevitably be criticized, and do we really want to set them up for that? Of course we’ll coo over them when they meet the world’s most famous pop stars, but holding them up as an example of how to wear the hot new color on the runways is simply unnecessary —  we have plenty of other famous people who, by choosing their roles in the public eye, volunteer for that kind of criticism.
Sasha and Malia Obama: Kids or Fashion Plates?

Sasha and Malia Obama Style - Sasha and Malia Obama Cuba | Teen Vogue
===============
]
*   
*   
*   
*   
*   
*   
*   
*   
*   
Let Sasha and Malia Obama Show You How to Dress for Spring Break
================================================================
Total vacation goals.
!
By 
March 21, 2016
The news may have been focused on President Obama's groundbreaking trip to Cuba, but to us, Sasha and Malia's outfits stole the spotlight.
Of course, that's hardly news: Sasha and Malia Obama have . Still, , and the outfits they wore to arrive in Cuba are just another example of that.
#### Instagram content
This content can also be viewed on the site it  from.
Malia played with pattern mixing by wearing a dress with two different floral prints - a bold but sophisticated style move. She finished the look with perfectly on-trend lace-up pointed toe black flats, which were later swapped for white Stan Smiths.
Her sister Sasha went the opposite route in a  with white contrast detailing. She also wore sneaks, but brought a pair of black slip ons instead.
Though each sister looks totally unique, they each are a lesson in spring break dressing: Whether you're going sight seeing or heading to dinner after a day on the beach, both of these outfits are easy-to-pack options for getting away in style.
**Related:**

website_quality_evaluation.justification: Teen Vogue has transformed over the years from a fashion magazine to a publication that covers various cultural and political issues relevant to younger audiences. It provides thoughtful and well-researched articles, with a focus on social issues, although it may sometimes lean towards a more advocacy-oriented perspective. Overall, it is a reliable source for engaging content on contemporary issues.
